page.title: 08FARMING INTERVIEW
page.content: Owns l000 acres; half is still tenanted in 5 small units. The main product is grass. The Dairy has 200 Friesians and Holsteins; there are l00 Devon red and 60 Herefords for beef, and 300 young stock, also trial crosses between the above and between North Devons and Charolais. Has North Devons but milk though high in butterfat is low in yield and the beef is "marbled " and unpopular. Extended buildings at Cockington house the young stock; the dairy is outside study area. Cattle first crop the grass, then sheep follow as they nibble closer. Keeps longwools - Devons, Dorsets and Border Leicesters.
